thread.title: Trending: Arsene Wenger charged over official incident vs. Burnley
thread.title_full: Trending: Arsene Wenger charged over official incident vs. Burnley

author: ESPN staff
title: Trending: Arsene Wenger charged over official incident vs. Burnley
text:
less than a minute ago Trending: Arsene Wenger charged over official incident vs. Burnley Arsenal were awarded a controversial penalty in the dying moments to secure all three points and second place in the Prem. Arsenal were awarded a controversial penalty in the dying moments to secure all three points and second place in the Prem. Arsenal have now moved into second in the Prem table, but the FC panel are skeptical if anyone can threaten Chelsea. Arsene Wenger apologises for his tirade after being frustrated with the late penalty awarded to Burnley. 
Here are the latest stories for Monday. 
- Former referees Keith Hackett and Graham Poll are calling for Wenger to get a lengthy ban for pushing the fourth official on Sunday. 
- Arsenal will be without Granit Xhaka for next month's showdown with Premier League leaders Chelsea after he was banned for four games. 
- Bournemouth striker Benik Afobe says Jack Wilshere remains uncertain whether he has a future at Arsenal. 
CHELSEA : Chelsea coach Antonio Conte has said he hoped Diego Costa had put an end to speculation surrounding his future after making a goal-scoring return to the side in Sunday's 2-0 home win over Hull City . 
- David Luiz shrugged off the recent attention surrounding his Chelsea teammate Costa, telling SFR Sport that "people talk a lot without knowing anything." 
HULL : Hull City midfielder Ryan Mason has been speaking to club officials who visited him in hospital on Monday morning after he underwent surgery on a fractured skull, the Premier League club have announced. 
MAN UNITED : Jose Mourinho will not stand in Wayne Rooney's way if the Manchester United captain decides to move to China . 
- Ruud Gullit has told the Daily Mirror that Paul Pogba must focus on his football career before any off-field distractions or he could follow a similar path to Memphis Depay and end up leaving Manchester United without fulfilling his potential. 
- Mourinho has said it would be difficult to make changes to his side despite recent dropped points due to the quality of the players' performances. 
BARCELONA : Luis Enrique feels Barcelona still need to improve if they are to reach their targets this season after they beat Eibar 4-0 on Sunday to stretch their winning run to four games in all competitions. 
LIVERPOOL : Jurgen Klopp has said Liverpool are keen to reinforce the squad in the January window but have been frustrated by clubs' refusal to do business in mid-season.
